main event: An unidentified aircraft was sighted at approximately 30,000 feet, observed visually and picked up on radar by a B-36 aircraft.
interesting points: The aircraft was reported to have uncontrolled running lights., The ECM frequencies noted during the sighting were 907, 3076, 9324, 9331, 7352, 715 and 730 mcs., Radar interference was continuously noted until the aircraft were 180 miles from the Texas coast., The operators ruled out ground clutter, jamming, and other aircraft for the radar interference., Similar incidents were reported in the past involving B-36 aircraft, but no explanation was provided.
witness description: Major Paul E. Garhart, radar operator; 2/Sgt Donald E. Jenkins, ECM operator; 2/Sgt Doyt T. Larimore, ECM operator.
